task.name: importfitsidi
task.shortdescription: Convert a FITS-IDI file to a CASA visibility data set
task.description: Convert a FITS-IDI file to a CASA visiblity data set. If several files are given, they will be concatenated into one MS.

param.name: fitsidifile
param.description:
Name(s) of input FITS-IDI file(s) Default: none (must be supplied)
Examples: fitsidifile='3C273XC1.IDI' fitsidifile=['3C273XC1.IDI1','3C273XC1.IDI2']

param.name: vis
param.description:
Name of output visibility file Default: none
Example: outputvis='3C273XC1.ms'

param.name: constobsid
param.shortdescription: If True, give constant obs ID==0 to the data from all input fitsidi files (False = separate obs id for each file)
param.description: If True, give constant obs ID==0 to the data from all input fitsidi files (False = separate obs id for each file) Default: False (new obs id for each input file) Options: False|True

param.name: scanreindexgap_s
param.shortdescription: Min time gap (seconds) between integrations to start a new scan
param.description:
Min time gap (seconds) between integrations to start a new scan Default: 0. (no reindexing)
If > 0., a new scan is started whenever the gap between two integrations is > the given value (seconds) or when a new field starts or when the ARRAY_ID changes.

param.name: specframe
param.shortdescription: Spectral reference frame for all spectral windows in the output MS
param.description:
This frame will be used to set the spectral reference frame for all spectral windows in the output MS Default: GEO (geocentric) Options: GEO|TOPO|LSRK|BARY
NOTE: if specframe is set to TOPO, the reference location will be taken from the Observatories table in the CASA data repository for the given name of the observatory. You can edit that table and add new rows.

task.example: FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE THE TASK PAGES OF IMPORTFITSIDI IN CASA DOCS: https://casa.nrao.edu/casadocs/
